title: Hey Bronzelords, improve your summoning with this one easy trick
body:
First, I'm in Bronze. Don't take the 'Bronzelord' thing personally. :P

Second, smartcasting. Smartcasting is amazeballs and you should use it. My Braum is easily 25% more effective with Stand Behind Me and Unbreakable smartcasted. Thresh's Dark Passage can now just be thrown. Veigar can cast Dark Matter fast enough that Fizz can't escape Event Horizon before it lands. Ryze can spam like he lives in Nigeria.

Don't set everything to smartcast. I like having to manually target Teemo's Blinding Dart.  Braum's Glacial Fissure, Thresh's Flay, and Veigar's Event Horizon are things you'll probably want to manually adjust. But smartcasting will improve your response times, making you a better player. It's tricky to get used to, but worth it in the end.

replies.body:
Smartcast is pretty scary when you're not used to it.  But I would really encourage you to give it a shot.  Change is scary, don't get me wrong, but it's worth it!  It's going to take awhile, but eventually you'll find you can react faster and easier than before.

I started it on only a few champions that I knew very well.  At the time, I think it was Leona and Caitlyn.  But after awhile I was eager and willing to smart cast all the champs, then I started smartcasting items and summoner spells.  Also, I wouldn't jump into ranked games while you adjust :D.

Guide to Learning Smartcasting:

**The TL;DR:** I would start smartcasting with champs that already smartcast by default. Eventually, regular casting will feel so clunky you'll never go back.

My personal recommendation to begin smartcasting is Riven; her Q, W, and E already smartcasted by default, and after a while it gets really irritating to normal cast R because you're so used to mashing keys. Then you switch to smartcasting Wind Slash instead.
Then you play someone else like LeBlanc and you're like "wtf so clunky" and you switch over to smartcast and double the speed of your burst combo. Or Kat. Or... and eventually you just smartcast everyone.

This is true. In all aspects. For me, I took a champ I knew super well (lux) and just turned it on. I played a couple bot games to get used to the changed timing, but it only improved my game play. One can make split second plays better if they can split second cast! 

Two notes that (while seemingly obvious) caught me offguard : 
1) This doesn't transfer automatically to PBE. First PBE blitz game I played, I thought I was unable to cast abilities when I tried to hook. ROFL. 
2) This is a setting stored LOCALLY. Not server side. You have to reinstall league, you have to set this again. 

I would also recommend taking new champs into bot games at least once to get a feel for the abilities and their ranges on smart cast. Or a custom. 
At least at the beginning. Once you know the champs well enough, you should be able to wing it in game if you want to try someone new. 

Best of luck!

EDIT : I still wouldn't recommend smart casting VIktor's Q or Rumble's ult until you get REALLY used to where they land and how it reacts. It's not intuitive. I've sent many rumble ults off the side of the aram map because fail. XD
I started learning smartcast on Kogmaw {{champion:96}} His moves are really easy to get the hang of with smartcast, especially the ult.
I used smartcasting since lvl 25. :D It was much easier, no transition at all since I was a bigger scrub than i am now xD
you can aim there is option to show range indicators, you have hold down the bottom to aim then release to fire

I don't ranked very much, so I'm probably also around Bronze/Silver level, but I wanted to say there's a huge amount of stigma attached to smartcast because "you can't aim."

WELL GUESS WHAT BRONZELORDS check the box that says Use Range Indicator When Smartcasting or whatever and you get THE BEST OF BOTH WORLDS. You just have to hold down the button, release to cast, or right click to cancel.

BAM. YOU NOW NO LONGER HAVE ANY EXCUSE FOR NOT USING SMARTCAST.
Holy crap I gotta find this! It'll make so many things so much easier.
I just checked, and the checkbox is at the very bottom of the Hotkeys screen.
I think it should be more accessible imo. Like a tickbox at the bottom of the keybindings screen

Hit the escape key in game. 
For the abilities, click on the lightning bolt below them. This ability is now on smartcast. 

For those of you that play peeps like Morg, or someone else you might want to self cast stuff on quickly, you can turn smart & self cast on in the advanced menu (IE, if I don't choose a target for black shield, it black shields me. SUPER useful in lane... but can lead to teamfight mistakes).

I actually really, really hate this function lol. To me, the advantage of smartcast is the faster casting - one button and done. With the range indicators there's a delay that really throws me off. I know people that use it and to each his own, but for me the best of both worlds is to use SHIFT+Q, or SHIFT+W, or whatever. My default is smartcast, but using shift forces manual cast. So if there's ever a time where I want to cast something manually, just hit shift! For all other times, I want the immediate reaction of pure smartcast.

"Don't set everything to smartcast. I like having to manually target Teemo's Blinding Dart. Braum's Glacial Fissure, Thresh's Flay, and Veigar's Event Horizon are things you'll probably want to manually adjust"

or you could just be lazy like me and learn to live with that one awkward ward in the bush xD

> or you could just be lazy like me and learn to live with that one awkward ward in the bush xD

Or like 20 thousand awkward wards, but that is the price we pay to live the lazy life.....

Damnit, I missed that bush with the smart cast ward. Now the enemy team is going to mock me. 

Oh well. It was just a ward. XD

Yeah, I adjust my smart casting based on the champion I'm playing.. Things like Rumble ult, Varus Q, Viktor E, I'd rather manually cast. Most things are okay on smartcast for me, but there's always those outlying spells :s

I play vi a lot so q is always a weird thing to get used to with her, but if you hold the button it actually feels like you are charging the ability or holding it longer and making it stronger (I'm weird like that don't judge me xD)
I'm in Bronze and I've been using smartcast since level 7 o.o

Actually, it's surprising sometimes. I teach a lot of new players and for a few of them smart cast is a lot easier for them to get started with. 

I wonder if it has to do with having experience in certain video game genres first?

That's a good question.

I've discussed it with some fellow design enthusiasts at length. I know that when I started playing league. I played with a trackpad on my laptop. When I moved to a mouse and keyboard, my skill SKYROCKETED. 

But what I found was although my strategy wasn't 100% solid, small little pieces of my skillset were better than my peers. Like dodging a Blitz pull with a trackpad. You have to react like .2 seconds faster because it required an extra button press and actual thumb movement. 

So when I had an extra .2 seconds on my hands I was not only able to dodge, but retaliate faster than my peers. It didn't make me a world class champion, but it made noticeable differences in my strengths vs. the strengths of others.

What I find with smartcasting. Is people who start smartcasting early, have a worse sense of distance. And they miss more at long-range, they also have a worse sense of positioning. But they excel and fast rapid fire exchanges. While players who switched to smartcasting later in their gameplay, are far better at landing long-range skillshots but are a bit less skilled at short-range skirmishing. They tend to get spaghetti fingers when they're caught off guard but have a better sense of positioning in team fights which I think comes from the extra time they spent lining up skillshots pre-smartcasting.

This is really interesting.  I play on a laptop, but have always used an auxiliary keyboard and mouse.  Can't imagine how rough a trackpad would be xD.

Really interesting observation about early smartcasters being a bit better at skirmishing, but late smartcasters being better at positioning/actually hitting those skillshots.

As a non-smartcaster (at least currently...), I have to agree from experience that if you usually have the luxury of lining up skillshots, but are forced to fight in close-range, tight quarters, that things become fairly hectic pretty fast.

Would be interesting to see if some players were just naturally better (i.e., before practive/training) at hectic, close-quarters situations.

> Would be interesting to see if some players were just naturally better (i.e., before practive/training) at hectic, close-quarters situations.

I think this is absolutely true. I was a nervous wreck when just starting League whenever a lot started happening on screen. I remember my well-meaning friends leaning over my shoulder shouting "Q! Q! E! E! Q! RRRR oh man press R!" which only adds to the tension. 

Adrenaline can run high during your first big teamfights. I've seen some otherwise excellent typists forget where their hands are on the keyboard and not be able to press any abilities at all in the chaos.

> Would be interesting to see if some players were just naturally better (i.e., before practive/training) at hectic, close-quarters situations.

Definitely true. I play with a group of friends and we've all been playing for years. One of them can string  q q w e q r combos together like it's a dance. Me on the other hand, a simple "q w e r" during a surprise evelyn gank ends up looking like "qqq23wde3r" and I end up blowing a summoner, poping a few potions, and waisting a ward in the process XD
Hahaha the panic ward xD

Smartcast was bit hard for me to learn. The major online game I played before League was a game called Ragnarok Online, it's an MMORPG that is nothing like League obviously, but every spell in that game is used like a spell in this game without smart cast. So it took me quite a bit to get into the hang of Smartcast.

It took me about 2 years of playing before I swapped to smartcast coming from an MMO background, so I understand the feeling...

(I think I might have aggravated some of my friends with my stubbornness in this matter.)

Yeah, I got my friend into League, by the point he started I was already using Smartcast, I had to force him to do turn on smartcast. Eventually I convinced him to try it in a custom game and he tried it as Akali, ever since that custom game he has been using smartcast.
That's about how long it took me as well.

I used to play a lot of Starcraft before League. The term "smartcast" has a different meaning in that game ("When multiple units are given the same spell order, only one of them will comply") and wasn't introduced until SC2. 

However the league definition of smartcast was basically just the use of **Hotkeys**. I feel Starcraft and RTS's in general had you grow accustomed to using hotkeys for spells in order to stay quick and efficient. Luckily this also helped me in IRL when using hotkeys in Adobe products and such.

I actually have a bit to say on this, coming from a lagging East Coaster with a crumb-filled toaster of a computer.


I've been playing since Ziggs/Sejuani after watching the S1 Worlds. While I truly don't believe LoL is a  great game (it's good, not great. This community is so many negative points it's laughably sad), I've still embraced it because for better or worse, it's not only absurdly widespread across the world, but a benchmark for e-sports now and in years to come.

Be that as it may, my computer barely plays the game (56kb video RAM EXTRAVAGANZA). Over the years, even though my skill, map awareness, and playmaking puts me at the top in my group of friends, I've almost exclusively played Support for my entire time here because there are so many visual things that could crash me out of the game that it's easier to list off things and events that DON'T bugsplat me. However during the OFAs I found I wrecked face and carried on a team or game of Katarina's, even when grouped with people who mained her (or for that matter, owned her). Kat is the only thing in this game that gives me ZERO lag.

Kat really needs quickcasting to play her right though, so I started with her E - Shunpo. It's the kind of power you need to go off directly when you want it to, not a half second later cause you had to tap a button then click your mouse. I started playing her in TB. I beat Yasuos (he crashes me because he buys Shiv and ~that~ crashes me). I started quickcasting Q, and now even my 1 key is set to it. I played an ARAM the other night as Nidalee and chucking her spears  were the easiest it's ever been.

Because I aimed for years, I know how far they can travel.

Because I quickcast I barely have to think about setting them up.

But the biggest thing about switching is I DON'T CRASH ANYMORE. I still lag, cause, hey, you know, *East Coast, and Rito doesn't particularly care about us enough to actually level the playing field*. But I haven't crashed. I've can buy Shivs now. My friends can play LB and Velkozby and actually get back-up from me in a fight without me getting in range and getting booted to the desktop while I curse in skype.

The thing I'm trying to say is that, if you use a sub par rig to play, and your game is unbearably laggy during big fights, try swapping to the quickcast. I have a ~85% win rate as Rammus jungle in TB, and around 60% for Kat. I actually get to be the captain for my friends, and not the blind shotcaller asking what's happening while I load back in.
Nah, I smartcast EVERYTHING. But turn range indicators on, it's the best of both worlds :)
i don't see why you have to manually target certain skills when you can hold down the Q/W/E/R key for said skill and aim. if you don't like the positioning or aim, you can right click to cancel

I can't smartcast at all and I don't see the situation improving with practice. Smartcasting isn't for everyone, and my playstyle requires me to carefully aim my skillshots and predict my opponent's movement, given that I play at 270-300 ping.

The only thing I can smartcast is Cassiopea's E, and it's not worth to change the casting in the options menu when I can simply use my pinky to hold down shift while I mash E on someone.

That's not your playstyle being incompatible with smart cast as much as your hardware/connection.

You are right though, there's literally no benefit to using smartcast if your ping exceeds your reaction time

I'd like to add on to this that switching your attack move click (smart casted attack move) to A, can really save you some unneeded clicks.  I was struggling to get out of silver 1, and found this little trick..  Even though I come from a starcraft background and have always been good at stutter-stepping with right click-a-left click, now I just have to right click-a-right click-a...  The little things, oh and I hit gold today :)
There are very few reasons to not use smartcast on every ability... the only I maybe I wouldn't is on rumble ult. It will increase your speed tremendously, just learn the cast ranges.
Funny, Rumble ult is one of the things I absolutely would never want to normal cast, based on a few ARAMs I've played.

I was stuck in Silver 2 for the longest time, and noticed my biggest issue was that split second from hitting the button and left clicking. After get demoted a few times, I practiced smart casting and carried myself to Gold VERY quickly.

Just thought I'd come back and mention just how much better I've been playing with smartcasting on.  Landing Thresh hooks and Ezreal Qs is so much easier it's crazy.  I can now react instinctively instead of having to time everything and hope I can click faster than my target can juke.

I've been playing since January of 2011. I just switched to smartcasting on everything about... 4 months ago? I'll never go back. Getting used to it took a little bit but I love it now! Don't worry about fumbling around a bit while you get used to it.. you'll get it!

I smart cast pretty much everything and I started it at level 2 so I got very used to it quickly. When I picked up braum{{champion:201}} It allowed me to combo like a god. Since skillshots sometimes have deceptive cast ranges (ex. Blitz hook) I was making grabs others thought impossible.
that's just like me; i smartcast unbreakable, stand behind me and dark matter but i manually target glacial fissure
Thanks for the reminder OP, I completely forgot about smartcasting.  Enabling it in a custom game as I type this.  +1 fellow Bronzelord.

My best advice to those new to smartcasting: Start with just 1 ability.   You can toggle smart caster per ability. So just turn on 1 ability you use a lot. In time you're like, wow that's so much easier. And you notice "Damn I missed that, *turns on smart castings for that q* ah ha! That's better" and before you know it you're smart casting QWE and pwning.
Wait wait.. there is a smartcast? I didn't know about that. How does it work?
When you press e.g. your 'e' button it will cast on whatever your cursor is on without having to click.

and anything that is self only/active abilities like teemo's W and a few other self buffs or AoE buffs (karma's shield, janna shield etc will only cast when over a valid target) self buffs like teemo's w activate normally. WW w activates normally. it will greatly improve your proficiency as a summoner.

I always use smartcast with the targeting stuff still activated, so I can hold the button and check the range and angle and stuff. It's probably in between full smart cast and not using it at all in speed but it's what works best for me :/
Did you mistake Smartcast with Quickcast?
AFAIK they're the same thing. http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Quick_cast
